# Advance Procurement Notice for Standing Offer Services

 Defence Construction Canada - Ontario Region invites interested consultants to participate in an upcoming Standing Offer (SO) for Stone Conservator Consultant Services.

## Background
This Advance Procurement Notice (APN) serves as a preliminary announcement to interested consultants regarding a potential Standing Offer for Stone Conservator Services. However, it is essential to note that this notification is not a formal bid solicitation.

## Standing Offer Details
The Standing Offer aims to secure a consulting service provider to provide Quality Assurance (QA) testing and inspection services for heritage masonry restoration projects at CFB Kingston, Ontario. The services will include:

* Reviewing stone sourcing investigation reports
* Inspecting stone quality at quarry sites
* Coordinating with contractors and quarry owners to ensure quality control
* Assessing new quarries for stone material suitability

## Standing Offer Terms

* Duration: Three (3) years with an option to extend for two (2) additional one-year periods
* Budget: $500,000 with a potential maximum value of $750,000
* Anticipated postings: May 2023 (subject to Department of National Defence approval)

## Contact Information
To address any questions or concerns regarding this Advance Procurement Notice, please contact:

Robin Entwistle
Team Leader, Contract Services
Defence Construction Canada
robin.entwistle@dcc-cdc.gc.ca

You can access the bidding documents and submission portal on [www.merx.com](http://www.merx.com). Please note that fees may apply for access to these documents. For more information on pricing, please visit [https://www.merx.com/public/pricing](https://www.merx.com/public/pricing). 

# Existing Trade Agreements
This Standing Offer is subject to the following trade agreements:

* Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA)
* World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO GPA)
* Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
